alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Montour; Northumberland; Schuylkill (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 05 at 9:45AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF COLUMBIA...NORTHUMBERLAND... MONTOUR...AND SCHUYLKILL COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 944 AM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Milton to Shamokin to near Pottsville to near Schuylkill Haven and moving southeast at 10 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Tremont, Buck Run and Donaldson around 950 AM EST. Branchdale and Pine Grove around 955 AM EST. Forrestville around 1005 AM EST. Heckscherville around 1010 AM EST. Minersville around 1015 AM EST. Seltzer and Slabtown around 1020 AM EST. * For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Limestoneville and Bloomsburg-Light Street exits, specifically from mile markers 218 to 232. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 81 from mile markers 103 to 120. Interstate 180 from mile markers 5 to 6. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
